div.p: RUDBECK (Olaus), a learned Swediſh phyſician, born of an ancient and noble family in 1630. He became profeſſor of medicine at Upſal, where he acquired great applauſe by his extenfive knowledge ; and died in 1702. His principal works are, I. Exercitatio ana· tοmica, exhibens dufius novos hepaticos aquoſos, Cl vaſa glandularum ſeroſa, in 4t0. He there afferts his claim to the diſcovery of the lymphatic veſſels, againſt the pretenſions of Thomas Bartholin. 2. Λthlaniica, βυe Manheim, vera fſapheti pοβerοrum ſedes ac patria, 4 <vols folio, is full of ſtrange paradoxes ſupported with profound learning : he there endeavours to prove, that Sweden was the country' whence all the ancient Pagan •divinities and our firſt parents were derived ; and that the Germans, Engliſh, French, Danes, Greeks, and Romans, with all other nations, originally came from thence.
